topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1: Overview

section.p: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade is a carrier grade OpenStack solution plus compute and network functions virtualization (NFV) offering that enables CSPs to deploy applications on open source software platforms.

Some key examples include the host operating system (for example, Linux), server virtualization (KVM), network virtualization (vSwitch and SDN controllers), an installer and cloud lifecycle management framework, fault and performance management, and high-availability framework for the OpenStack control plane and the NFVI layer.

HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade is based on HP Helion Openstack 1.1 but with significantly enhanced and optimized functionality, availability, scale and performance to meet the needs of NFV cloud deployments.
Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade includes following key components:

ul.li: OpenStack—core services including Horizon, Nova, Neutron, Cinder, Glance, Swift, Keystone, Ceilometer, and Heat. Other services will be added as needed in the future.

Compute node software package that includes:
Carrier-grade Linux (host operating system [OS] running on the compute nodes)
Carrier-grade KVM (for virtualization of the compute node)
Carrier-grade accelerated virtual switch (AVS), data plane development kit (DPDK)-enabled high-performance virtual switch
Management and middleware—composed of high-availability (HA) management; operations, administration, and maintenance (OAM); software image management; and fault and performance management
Guest software development kit (SDK) for inclusion in the guest OS of the VNF for performance acceleration and improving the HA framework above and beyond standard VIMs
HP Helion Lifecycle Manager (HLM)—cloud installer and lifecycle manager
Near-line rate networking throughout for VNFs like vEPC, vBRAS, vIMS, vFW, vRouter etc.
Advanced resource scheduling and orchestration capabilities
NIC Bonding at the server level
Compute Node failure detection and Auto-evacuation in kvm region

section.p: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade is comprised of a number of services, including several OpenStack and HP Helion OpenStack services.

body.section:
Installation OptionsHP Helion OpenStack Carreir Grade has two baremetal installation options depending on your system configuration. It allows you to manage the KVM and VMware ESX hypervisors and provision virtual machines.
You can find more information on the hypervisor options in the Technical Overview.

section.title: KVM Topology
section.p: If you install the KVM deployment, you can integrate either HP Storevirtual (VSA) or HP StoreServ (3PAR) storage in the KVM region.

ul.li:
With HP StoreVirtual VSA storage
HP StoreVirtual VSA software is a Virtual Storage Appliance that provides the complete array functionality on top of a Linux KVM environment without external hardware. VSA eliminates the need for external shared storage required to implement Block Storage features.

With HP StoreServ (3PAR) storage
HP 3PAR StoreServ is a storage array that supports Fibre Channel (FC) as well as iSCSI protocol.

section.p: You must install 3PAR or VSA before starting the HP Helion OpenStack installation and are independent of HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.

body.section:
KVM + ESX TopologyThe ESXi/DCN integration enables data-center-to-data-center communications through DCN, which connects to the KVM region through a gateway (VRS-G).
HP Helion OpenStack supports VMWare ESX hypervisor. With our ESX integration, you can provision and manage an overcloud ESX cluster. VMWare vCenter Compute driver is used as a part of ESX integration. The VMware vCenter driver connects to ESX clusters in a vCenter through Compute proxy nodes.
Virtual networking between HP Helion Carrier Grade and the ESX servers is handled by HP Distributed Cloud Networking (DCN) is a software-defined networking (SDN) solution that enhances data center (DC) network virtualization by automatically establishing connectivity between compute resources upon their creation.
The ESX integration uses the OVSvApp application to connect the vCenter networking to the Network Operations controller to manage workload networks.
You can also integrate HP Storevirtual (VSA) or HP StoreServ (3PAR) storage in the KVM region.
You must install ESX, 3PAR or VSA before starting the HP Helion OpenStack installation and are independent of HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.

section.title: Unbonded or Bonded NIC configuration
section.p: The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation allows for network interface card bonding (bonded NIC).
